monogr.title: The reward of the wicked : preached in a sermon at Linfield in Sussex, and publi [she] d at the request of some welld [is] sed [sic] Christians by Humphrey Everenden
monogr.author: Everinden, Humphrey

div.head: To the Christian Reader.
div.p: THe meanes of edification in the holy Scripture (gentle Reader) may all be referred to three heads. Instructions for all. Consolations for the oppressed. Threats, for those that erre and are obstinate. These make a threefold cord, whereby God laboured to draw mankind to this end. Heere hast thou one strane twisted, viz. the iudgement or death of the damned. If therefore Gods mercies cannot alure thee to loue him, heere hast thou his iudgement to scourge thee, that thou maist feare him, that begining thy wisdome in feare, thou maist so learne to loue him, that his iudgements being bitter to thy tast, may cause thee to seeke to try how good he is in his mercies. God giue his blessing to his owne ordinance, for thy good.
